menstruation.name: Menstruation Phase
menstruation.info: The uterine lining is being shed. Low estrogen and progesterone levels often lead to fatigue.

details.emoji: The moon üåô symbolizes this phase of rest and withdrawal. Just as the moon cycles through its phases, your body goes through its natural rhythm. It's time to look inward and regenerate.
details.body: During this phase, the built-up uterine lining is shed. Hormone levels are at their lowest.
details.physical: Your belly may feel bloated. Many women experience mild water retention, especially in their legs. Skin can become blemished or drier. Due to the bleeding, you may feel physically weaker.
details.energy: Your energy level is at its lowest. Allow yourself rest and be gentle with yourself.
details.mood: You may feel tired, emotional, or withdrawn. This is completely normal.
details.tips: Focus on adequate sleep, warming teas, and gentle movement like yoga or walks.

menstruation.description: The uterine lining is being shed. Low estrogen and progesterone levels often lead to fatigue.

follicular.name: Follicular Phase
follicular.info: After bleeding, new follicles mature. Rising estrogen levels can increase energy and wellbeing.

details.emoji: The young plant üå± represents growth and new beginnings. After menstruation, your body awakens to new life. Like a seed sprouting, you rebuild energy and prepare for your most productive phase.
details.body: New follicles mature in the ovaries. Estrogen levels rise continuously.
details.physical: Your body feels lighter. Water retention decreases and your belly becomes flatter. Skin glows and becomes clearer. Many women feel most comfortable in their bodies during this phase.
details.energy: Your energy increases daily. Perfect for new projects and challenges!
details.mood: You feel motivated, creative, and social. Use this positive phase!
details.tips: Ideal for more intensive training, starting new ventures, and social activities.

follicular.description: After bleeding, new follicles mature. Rising estrogen levels can increase energy and wellbeing.

ovulation.name: Ovulation Phase
ovulation.info: A mature follicle ruptures, releasing the egg into the fallopian tube. This is the time of maximum fertility.

details.emoji: The blossom üå∏ symbolizes the peak of your cycle. Like a flower in full bloom, you stand at the summit of your fertility, energy, and radiance during this phase.
details.body: Ovulation occurs - the egg is released. Hormones reach their peak.
details.physical: Your skin has a natural glow, lips may appear fuller. Cervical mucus becomes clear and stretchy. Some women feel ovulation through mild pain (mittelschmerz) in the lower abdomen. You feel physically most attractive.
details.energy: Peak performance! Your energy and radiance are at maximum.
details.mood: You feel confident, attractive, and communicative. Best time for important conversations!
details.tips: Use your energy for important projects, dates, or intensive workouts.

ovulation.description: A mature follicle ruptures, releasing the egg into the fallopian tube. This is the time of maximum fertility.

luteal.name: Luteal Phase
luteal.info: The ruptured follicle produces progesterone. The lining thickens further. Energy often decreases, PMS may occur.

details.emoji: The autumn leaf üçÇ represents transition and letting go. As nature prepares for winter, your body prepares for menstruation. It's time to slow down and focus on what's essential.
details.body: The corpus luteum produces progesterone. The uterus prepares for possible pregnancy.
details.physical: Water retention increases, especially in belly, breasts, and legs. Breasts may feel tender and sensitive. Belly bloats. Skin can become more blemished. Some women gain 1-2 kg that disappears after menstruation.
details.energy: Your energy decreases. Time for more self-care and relaxation.
details.mood: PMS symptoms may occur. You may need more rest and withdrawal.
details.tips: Focus on relaxing activities, healthy nutrition, and adequate sleep. Be compassionate with yourself.

luteal.description: The ruptured follicle produces progesterone. The lining thickens further. Energy often decreases, PMS may occur.

menstruation.intro: During menstruation, you lose blood and important nutrients. Your body needs extra support for regeneration now.
menstruation.description: Focus on iron-rich foods to compensate for blood loss. Magnesium helps with cramps, omega-3 fatty acids have anti-inflammatory effects.

nutrients.name: Iron
nutrients.why: Compensates for blood loss and prevents fatigue

nutrients.name: Omega-3
nutrients.why: Has anti-inflammatory effects and reduces pain

nutrients.name: Vitamin B12
nutrients.why: Supports blood formation and provides energy

follicular.intro: In the follicular phase, your body rebuilds the uterine lining. Estrogen levels rise and you have more energy.
follicular.description: Light, nutrient-rich food with lots of protein and B vitamins supports growth and your rising energy. Now is the best time for fresh vegetables and whole grains.

nutrients.name: Protein
nutrients.why: Builds up the uterine lining and provides energy

nutrients.name: Folic Acid
nutrients.why: Important for cell growth and division

nutrients.name: Vitamin A
nutrients.why: Promotes healthy skin and mucous membranes

ovulation.intro: During ovulation, your estrogen levels peak. Your body is running at full capacity and needs lots of energy.
ovulation.description: Antioxidants protect the egg, complex carbohydrates provide sustained energy. Fiber helps break down excess estrogen.

nutrients.name: Antioxidants
nutrients.why: Protect the egg and fight free radicals

nutrients.name: Complex Carbs
nutrients.why: Provide long-lasting energy for your peak phase

luteal.intro: In the luteal phase, progesterone levels rise. Your body prepares for possible pregnancy and may become sluggish.
luteal.description: Complex carbs stabilize blood sugar and mood. Magnesium and vitamin B6 help with PMS symptoms. Avoid too much salt due to water retention.

nutrients.name: Complex Carbs
nutrients.why: Stabilize blood sugar and mood during PMS

nutrients.name: Magnesium
nutrients.why: Reduces water retention and mood swings

nutrients.name: Vitamin B6
nutrients.why: Relieves PMS symptoms and regulates hormones

nutrients.name: Calcium
nutrients.why: Reduces cramps and supports bone health

bmiInfo.point1: BMI is a screening tool, not a diagnosis
bmiInfo.point2: Factors like age, gender, and muscle mass are not considered
bmiInfo.point3: Consult medical professionals for an accurate assessment

follicular.description: In the follicular phase, your energy rises! Perfect for new challenges and more intense training. Your body can handle more now.

ovulation.description: During ovulation, you're at peak strength! Use this phase for your most intense training and new personal bests.

luteal.description: In the luteal phase, your energy slowly decreases. Moderate movement and stability help with PMS symptoms.
